input.content: Inhabitants of an island lie consistently on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays, and they tell the truth on the other four days of the week. You have forgotten what day of the week it is, so you ask a passerby. 'Saturday,' he answers. 'And what day will it be tomorrow?' you inquire. 'Wednesday,' he replies. Can you tell what day it is today?

prompt.ideal: Based on answer 1, today cannot be M, W, F, Su, or Sa (lying day). Based on answer 2, today cannot be M, W, F, Su, or Tu (lying day). So, today must be Thursday.

input.content: Which word does NOT belong with the others? A. index B. glossary C. chapter D. book

sampled.completion:
1. (a) a person who acts or has the power to act for another; (b) a helper or assistant. (Collins)
This morning I have been reflecting on the role we each have in the body of Christ.
We all have a part to play, a role to fill and a purpose we were created for.
God is looking for those who will willingly take up their position as an assistant in His kingdom.
Those who are available and willing to do the tasks He has given them to do, with no questions or arguments.
I believe there are many Christians who have been called into the role of assistant in the kingdom.
I see them in various places in the church, doing the work God assigned them, quietly but faithfully.
Their role is to assist, help and serve others so that the work of the ministry can be accomplished.
These people are not usually seen or appreciated by the world, but God sees everything they do.
He sees their heart and their willingness to serve in whatever capacity He calls them to.
These are the ones who are willing to be the least in the kingdom, not desiring recognition or position.
These are the ones who are the most humble and the most precious in the kingdom of God.
If we are called to be a foot soldier, we need to be faithful to our calling.
If we are called to be the captain of a company, we need to be faithful to our calling.
If you are an assistant, be the best assistant you can be and be content with that.
God knows the work you have been assigned to do, but do not be surprised if one day He calls you into a higher position.
Remember that you have been called according to His purpose and not your own.
Be faithful, trust God and He will promote you.
Speak this out today…..”Thank you Lord for the role you have given to me in your kingdom

sampled:
1. an important person who helps someone in a position of power
Helper: 1. someone or something that helps
Assistant = subset of Helper
So, (C).

input.content: At a party, there are 100 people. Some always lie and some always tell the truth. They all know which one of them is a truth-teller and which one is a liar. After the party, you ask each person how many truth-tellers they shook hands with. Each person gives a different answer, ranging from 0 to 99. How many were truth-tellers and how many were liars?

prompt.ideal: There is 1 truth-teller and 99 liars at the party.

sampled.completion:
[00:04:38] And I think that the thing that makes it a little bit more difficult to do a lot of those things is the fear of making a mistake.
Dr. Z: [00:04:46] Yeah, absolutely. And I’ve been there and done that. I mean, I have been so scared and so worried that something I was going to do might not work out that I did nothing, you know?
And the more I’ve realized, “Wait a minute, I’m not going to be able to do things the way it’s been done before because I’m not you. So, I’m going to have to create my own style, and I’m going to have to be willing to make a mistake. And that’s okay. And I’ll pick myself up, dust myself off, and keep on going.” That has really made a huge difference.
And so, I think, you know, we’re all going to make mistakes. We’re human. And we can’t be so scared of making a mistake that we end up not taking any action at all. You know, that’s really what makes us not be able to do the things that we really want to do, and that’s really, you know, going to keep us stuck where we are for a lot longer.
[00:05:40] I’ve also heard you talk about how we tend to over-think things.
Dr. Z: [00:05:44] Oh my gosh, yeah, I do a lot of that! I am an over-thinker.
You know, I mean, I’ll have ideas. I have ideas all day long about stuff I can do, and stuff that I want to do, and things that I could do that might be cool, and then I’ll start trying

input.content: Two people want to cross a river. The only way to get across is with a boat that they find on one side; but that boat can only take one person at a time. The boat cannot return on its own, and there are no ropes to haul it back, yet both persons manage to cross using the boat. How did they do it?

prompt.ideal: The people are on different sides of the river, so the person on the same side as the boat originally can cross first to bring the boat to the side with the other person, then that person can cross.

input.content: The day before yesterday, Chris was 7 years old. Next year he'll turn 10. How is this possible?

prompt.ideal: Assuming today is January 1st of any given year: Two days ago, on December 30th, Chris was 7 years old. The next day, on December 31st, Chris celebrated his 8th birthday. On December 31st of this year, Chris will celebrate his 9th birthday. At the end of next year, on December 31st, Chris will turn 10 years old.

Location: Washington, DC
Position Overview
This position is for a dynamic and motivated individual to join our team. As an Assistant, you will have a variety of different responsibilities ranging from administrative and clerical tasks to customer service duties. You will also work closely with the President and other members of the management team to assist in daily activities as well as longer range strategic planning.
Primary Job Responsibilities
- Provide general office support including but not limited to answering telephones, ordering office supplies and managing office equipment
- Maintain a customer-focused attitude, providing exceptional customer service to our clients
- Assist with the preparation/coordination of internal reports and presentations
- Maintain a high level of confidentiality with all client information.
- Coordinate and schedule appointments and meetings.
Qualifications
- High School Diploma/GED, Associate or Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
- Minimum of one (1) to three (3) years office administrative experience.
- Ability to work with all levels of management to complete tasks with minimal supervision.
- Excellent organizational abilities, attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Please submit your resume to info@mcs-dc.com.
